fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40445].
  {panel}

As it stands the Permission scheme structure revolves around a whitelist format. However, there should be some sort of functionality to remove abilities for a certain group of people, outside of a larger group.

For instance, everyone who is added to our JIRA instance is automatically added to jira-users. All jira-users have permissions to browse projects (amongst other things) in the default notification scheme. This simplifies things because users when created are always added to this group. However, there is a small group of people we don't want to give the ability to browse all projects to.

In our default permission scheme - that is assigned to fifteen projects - we allow 'jira-users' to 'browse projects', and would like to exclude one group from this list - a group have permissions to browse another project in our JIRA instance which has it's own permission scheme giving them the ability to do so.

In essence, we have a group of people we only want to give access to one project, but because they are in the 'jira-users' group, and our default scheme is based around that for convenience, they have access to all projects. So, there should be some way of excluding a group from a permission, just as there is the ability to give a group permissions.

Thanks

I was developing OAuth implementation in our REST API client so we've created consumer in JIRA and I was using it for testing.

Next, we've created final consumer for application and old consumer was deleted, but my tokens were not revoked before it.

Now, I can allow new consumer to use my account, but when I want to [view my tokens|https://jira.3bpo.com/plugins/servlet/oauth/users/access-tokens] I get error 500 with stack:

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40434]. {panel} Steps: - Create a JSD service desk (enable it on top an JIRA project, for example) - On the customer portal, raise a request. - Search for the issue under the project. Select and follow the JIRA Bulk Edit wizard - On Step 3 of 4: Operation Details, scroll to "Change Customer Request Type" - Notice the description of the field is "

Holds information about which Service Desk was used to create an issue. This custom field is created programmatically. Please do not remove.

" !OD.png|thumbnail! Expected result: - The description is displayed without appending the "

" at the start / and of the description Note: - The description is displayed correctly under JIRA BTF !BTF.png|thumbnail! - The issue is not cause to JSD customfield's description, which is just plain text. The issue can be observed on some custom field like JIRA Agile "Change Developer" !Screen Shot 2014-10-10 at 2.22.39 PM.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40424].
  {panel}

An issue, and different resolutions tried to solve an issue are tracked by commenting on the issue.

It would be really helpful if these comments could have numbers, such that these comments can be referenced to in future comments.

Eg: if a testing strategy was proposed in comment:2 and several comments after, the results for the tests in comment:2 are posted, it could be posted on a new comment, with reference to comment:2 (which can be hyperlinked).

Kindly let me know if such a feature already exists (as I do not see the comments carry any numbers on Jira), else this feature would be a great plus.

Please refer to "trac" for an idea of what is being requested here.
fields.summary: Need for comment numbers and linking

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40423].
  {panel}

Whenever users need to take some time off (e.g. vacation), administrators need to move issues to different users that may require extra permission changes as well which will be kept in place only for a small amount of time.

It would be great if JIRA had a feature to add an user as a replacement for another user in a project.
This replacement would automatically have all of the user's permissions added to him as well as his tickets (assigned,reported and watched).

Other suggestions
* Assignee field apart from the person who is in charge of the issue, also the substitution (in brackets or something similar)
* In the list of watchers the substitution might be visible
* If an issue is set to the absent person, then there might be some message informing about setting also substitution
* "replacement" user might be able to receive all notifications which normally are addressed to the absent person (as reporter, assignee and watcher)
* also if there is any comment addressed to the absent person "replacement" user should be notified
fields.summary: Add user replacements in projects
Allow all assignable users when using Current User Security Level

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40420].
  {panel}

When entering the following JQL, a 500 error results: 'text ~ "staff"'

Example:
https://directemployersfoundation.atlassian.net/issues/?jql=text%20~%20%22staff%22

Other keywords (ie "staf") return search results without issue. Below is the crash report:

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40417].
  {panel}

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-39749
As quoted from the above ticket regarding 2 types of CSV import
{quote}Yes the both importers are looking similar, but in the background they are completly different and that's intended - we coudn't give non-admins an exact copy of CSV Importer.

    CSV Importer for Administrators (from "External System Import" menu).
    It was designed as a migration tool - it takes the data from file and does everything in it's power to fit them in JIRA. So without any additional question it creates resolutions/priorities/users/etc. and does all transition/status work in silence to allow user to create issues as much similar to what he/she has in the external issue tracker as possible.
    Bulk Create for non-admins (from "Issues" top menu)
    It looks similar, but it's 100% secure solution for creating issues, it checks all of the necessary permissions and allows only to create issues with "Open" status. It doen't have all of functionality of the 1. importer and it never will have all of them, but we'll slowly add all missing features that we believe that are safe to be implemented.
{quote}

As both imports are intended to be different, there should be a documentation for both of those. There is already a documentation about the *External System Import* found [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Importing+Data+from+CSV] but there isn't any documentation about the newer CSV import
fields.summary: Import from CSV (Bulk Create) documentation

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40415].
  {panel}

h3. Current Behaviour
Audit log is always *enabled* in JIRA.

The only available options for the audit log is to change the retention period under Audit log Settings. Only having this 3 options:
* 1 month 
* 3 months 
* 6 months

h3. Feature Request
In cases when users want to delete or disable Audit Logs. Alternatively, able to configure for the 1 day on the Audit Log Retention period.
fields.summary: Ability to change Audit Log Rentention Period to 1 day or Disabling Audit Logs

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40398].
  {panel}

When migrating from JIRA Cloud, the following error is being thrown in the UI:
!error.jpg|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to reproduce:

# Generate and download a Backup from a Cloud instance.
# Install a clean instance of JIRA Server latest version.
# During the setup, click to import existing data, and import the backup from JIRA Cloud.
# The error will be thrown.

h3. Workaround:

# Uncompress the Backup.zip originated from JIRA Cloud.
# Open the entities.xml file.
# Search for the JIRA Cloud build number (64005) which should return results like the following:
{code:xml}
    </OSPropertyString>
    <OSPropertyString id="1" value="64005"/>
{code}
{code:xml}
        </OSPropertyString>
    <OSPropertyString id="11130" value="64005"/>
    <OSPropertyString id="11131" value="1.1.5"/>
{code}
# Change the {{value}} from 64005 to 6337:
{code:xml}
    </OSPropertyString>
    <OSPropertyString id="1" value="6337"/>
{code}
{code:xml}
    </OSPropertyString>
    <OSPropertyString id="11130" value="6337"/>
    <OSPropertyString id="11131" value="1.1.5"/>
{code}
# Compress the entities.xml and activeobjects.xml again, and import the .zip to the clean JIRA instance.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40392].
  {panel}

h3. Current Behaviour
The issue to which the comment is added is chosen from the first issue key found in the email subject.

h3. Feature Request
The issue to which the comment is added is chosen when the user uses the same subject to create the issue. 

{panel:title=Example Use Case|borderStyle=dashed|borderColor=#ccc|titleBGColor=#F7D6C1  |bgColor=#FFFFCE  }
One of our customers uses a 3rd party tool to manage its tickets. This 3rd tool sends us notifications any time a ticket is assigned to us and any time a ticket already assigned to us gets updated with comments or feedback.
We are using our JIRA OnDemand i
nstance to keep everything in place. Each time a notification is received from the 3rd party we would like to automatically create or update a ticket in JIRA. For the update part, the only thing that is common (and unique, the 3rd party tool has unique subjects for the tickets) is the subject of the ticket.
Our customer is stubborn and does not want to work on our JIRA OnDemand platform. We want to keep everything in one place, meaning in our JIRA. But we also do not want to manually add the tickets from our mailing system. This makes us crazy!
After creating our JIRA ticket we have no chance to give the 3rd party tool our Issue Key back so that it could rewrite its email for the future notification. This is impossible (I know nothing is impossible but ... this is ).
{panel}
fields.summary: JIRA mail handler to comment an issue without issue key

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40388].
  {panel}

Currently the Notification Helper feature can check if the user can receive a Notification from the Notification Scheme associated to the Project according to the Notification Scheme configuration.

However, in some cases the user is missing a Permission on the Permission Scheme causing the user not to receive notifications, even though the Notification Helper says that the user can receive Notifications according to the  Notification Scheme.

It may confuse JIRA Administrators because the Notification Helpers is saying that the User can receive notifications, when he can't.

It would be nice if the Notification Helper could verify the Permission Scheme along with the Notification Scheme and point an error when a determined user can't receive notifications due to a Permission issue.
fields.summary: Notification Helper should verify Permission Scheme.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40379].
  {panel}

When running JIRA 6.3.7 with cluster.properties present the wizard refers to generating an eval, which is a marketplace url with a bunch of params. These params do not seem to cause a license to be generated that is compatible with the JIRA 6.3.7 configured for data-center.

This bug is that the JIRA licenses that my.atlassian.com generates in response to JIRA 6.3.7 links/at all, are not compatible with JIRA datacenter installation.  Either the license generated is wrong, or the wizard referring those Eval licenses during a cluster setup is wrong.

Current outcome is that nobody can seemingly just evaluate JIRA datacenter, other than have prior knowledge that a [cluster timebomb|https://developer.atlassian.com/display/MARKET/Timebomb+Licenses+for+Testing] license exists.

Sure, Atlassian may expect customers to do this via an Expert who could well know this already, but regardless this would appear kind of a blocker for new evaluators?!
fields.summary: JIRA Evaluation licenses from my.atlassian.com do not work for datacenter

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40375].
  {panel}

*Symptom*:
* error thrown in the JIRA UI indicating "'<user>' does not exist"
* repeating the same step will throws random username does not exist

*Step to reproduce*:
# install JIRA with internal directory
# create a new Internal with Delegated Authentication directory
# migrate the users directory from internal to delegated authentication directory
# (bug) error thrown in the JIRA UI indicating "'<user>' does not exist"
# (bug) in the JIRA logs:
{code}
/plugins/servlet/embedded-crowd/directories/migrate/ [embedded.admin.directory.MigrateDirectoryUsersController] User migration failed
java.lang.RuntimeException: com.atlassian.crowd.exception.UserNotFoundException: User <johndoe> does not exist
        at com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.admin.directory.MigrateDirectoryUsersController$1.doInTransaction(MigrateDirectoryUsersController.java:146)
        ...

Caused by: com.atlassian.crowd.exception.UserNotFoundException: User <johndoe> does not exist
at com.atlassian.jira.crowd.embedded.ofbiz.OfBizUserDao.findByName(OfBizUserDao.java:85)
at com.atlassian.jira.crowd.embedded.ofbiz.OfBizDelegatingMembershipDao.addUserToGroup(OfBizDelegatingMembershipDao.java:81)
at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.AbstractInternalDirectory.addUserToGroup(AbstractInternalDirectory.java:821)
at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.DelegatedAuthenticationDirectory.addUserToGroup(DelegatedAuthenticationDirectory.java:805)
at com.atlassian.crowd.manager.directory.DirectoryManagerGeneric.addUserToGroup(DirectoryManagerGeneric.java:757) 
{code}
# (bug) username thrown in the error cannot login into JIRA using the password stored in LDAP

*To verify*:
# make sure the error is not caused by bug [JRA-24889|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-24889]
# in the JIRA database check if the user does exist correctly in the {{app_user}}, {{cwd_user}}, {{cwd_membership}}. The SQL queries below can be use:
{code:sql}
select * from app_user where lower_user_name='<sample_username>';
select * from cwd_user where user_name ='<sample_username>';
select * from cwd_membership where child_name ='<sample_username>';
select * from cwd_directory;
{code}
# Important note: restoring the JIRA's data into a test instance and the problem is not reproducible in the test instance.


*Root Cause*:
Broken Cache when creating the user in the new directory.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40373].
  {panel}

When a keyboard-only user activates an element to open a menu of options, the menu is not injected into the dom following the control element. for example, when a keyboard-only user activates the "workflow" link, the user is not informed that a menu has opened (WCAG 3.2.2), and the menu opens at the bottom of the dom (WCAG 1.3.2, WCAG 2.4.3).
Recommendations:
1. Add aria attribute to inform user that link has a popup
2. Inject the contents into the dom immediately following the control
fields.summary: Screen reader users are not notified that a link opens a menu, and the menus do not open near the control element in the dom

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40364].
  {panel}

One of the recent changes in JIRA 6 is about [Velocity files must encode the results of methods|https://developer.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/Preparing+for+JIRA+6.0#PreparingforJIRA6.0-Velocityfilesmustencodetheresultsofmethods]. This will force velocity files to encode the results of methods. The changes also remove the ability of inserting HTML tag into Custom Field's description and value.

Confluence has its [Anti-XSS Documentation|https://developer.atlassian.com/display/CONFDEV/Anti-XSS+documentation] available. We need similar page available for JIRA, because it is not easy to find the written changes and to communicate it to the customer.

Related documentations:
- https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/173562/custom-fields-with-html-content-dont-work-after-upgrade-to-jira-6-0
- https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/229743/html-tags-on-field-descriptions-not-working-on-jira-6
- https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/237121/jira-and-anti-xss
- https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-28776
- https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-37576
- https://jamieechlin.atlassian.net/browse/GRV-261
- https://developer.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/Preparing+for+JIRA+6.0#PreparingforJIRA6.0-Velocityfilesmustencodetheresultsofmethods
- https://developer.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/Velocity+Templates
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to find a centralized documentation about the Anti-XSS changes in JIRA 6

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40363].
  {panel}

Latest Jira OnDemand version has this system add-on appearing as a user-installed add-on:
* Gadget Spec Publisher Plugin

If disabled by the admin user, Jira will be locked at restart.

They were listed as System add-on previously.

Customers disable plugins in desire of getting better performance out of their instance and end up needing Support to restore functionality.

*Workaround:*
Plugins can be enable by following [JIRA does not Start Due to Disabled Bundled Plugin|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/JIRA+does+not+Start+Due+to+Disabled+Bundled+Plugin]
fields.summary: Gadgets Spec Publisher add-on shows on user-installed list and can be disabled by customers in OD
Allow administrators to disable CAPTCHA for specific users

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40356].
  {panel}

I use Agile boards heavily and often use JQL filters to display tickets across multiple projects (e.g. One corporate initiative has tickets in several Jira projects and the sponsor wants one Agile board to look at, not 10).  The problem I have is that there is no reasonable way to include sub-tasks, from multiple projects, in you Agile Work Board.  

Example:
- Project A has a sprint that includes tickets relevant only to the team (e.g. code refactoring) AND to a corporate initiative (e.g. deliver dependency A to team Z)
- Project B has the same situation

There is no JQL that I can use to create an Agile Board that displays the sub-tasks relevant to the corporate initiative in both projects.  If I use "project in (Project A, Project B)" I get the refactoring tickets.  If I use "fixversion = 'Corporate Initiative'", I don't get sub-tasks because they don't inherit the FixVersion of the parent when you drag-n-drop on the Agile Plan Board.  And I can't use "Epic Link" in my JQL because you can only set one Epic per ticket and I can't force teams to put all Corporate Initiative tickets into a single Epic or they lose a lot of value from setting their own epics.

So what to do??  I can't think of any reason why a sub-task would not inherit the FixVersion from it's parent when it is dragged onto a version in the Agile Plan Board.  It would be a gross violation of Scrum principles to say that the parent is being planned into a release, but the sub-tasks are in a different release.

The worst part about this is that there is no way to use JQL to find the relevant sub-tasks so that you can use Bulk Edit.  You basically need a nested JQL query like this:

parent in (fixversion = "Corporate Initiative"))
fields.summary: Set sub-task FixVersion when dragging it's parent Story to a version in Agile Plan Board

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40354].
  {panel}

Problem:
* Ensure you're not logged into CAC
* See the JIRA Doc Home page: 
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+Documentation
* There's a link for "Use JIRA in an enterprise environment"
* The link leads to: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ATLAS/Enterprise+Resources
** This is a private space that is not accessible by most users
* The link should actually be to: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ENTERPRISE/JIRA+Enterprise+Resources

I'd fix it myself, but I lack the privileges to do so.
fields.summary: Documentation - JIRA Enterprise Link Incorrect

As can be seen in the [deprecated list page|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/latest/deprecated-list.html]

{noformat}com.atlassian.jira.dashboard.permission.GadgetPermissionManager.filterGadgets(DashboardState, User)
          since 6.1 use GadgetPermissionManager.filterGadgets(com.atlassian.gadgets.dashboard.DashboardState, com.atlassian.jira.user.ApplicationUser) instead {noformat}

The error shows that plugin is using the newer interface but in the deprecated list, it is supposed to use the old interface as this is JIRA 6.0.X
fields.summary: Wallboard plugin version history does not display correct versions

fields.description: Various circumstances warrant someone entering an issue on behalf of someone else and entering the someone else's user id as the reporter.  Clicking the History tab, however, states the reporter id is the person that created the issue.  I feel the user id of the person creating the issue should be noted in the History tab, regardless of the name of the Reporter.
fields.summary: Entering another user id as reporter when creating an issue shows that user created it

h3. ***Summary***
Creating an Agile project causes the project creation to be stalled.

h3. ***Steps to Reproduce***
# Create project (Agile Scrum or Agile Kanban)
# Enter the details of the project
# Observe the project creation is stalled

fields.summary: JIRA Agile Project Creation Stalled
project REST API not returning all projects

fields.description:
I know there have been existing bugs about this but from what I could gather they 'appeared' to be closed.  

Here are the steps I followed - and perhaps there is another bug I just discovered that could be responsible
 * Make a new project with Software Development Workflow.  (Whenever I do this it never gets out of the spinning wheel so i have to hit CTRL+R to refresh the screen and see the new project)
 * Navigate to my new project - create an issue of type *TASK*
 * Open my issue hit the done button
 * Resolution status remains as UNRESOLVED

I do have agile installed and i didn't know if that interaction was causing an issue, also I realize that I have an issue with creating a project as it never gets out of that "CREATING PROEJCT" view...
fields.summary: Software Development Workflow not seting resolution states correctly

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40345].
  {panel}

Currently, Issue Navigator Columns only able to list down 24 custom fields based on the search filter, please see: 
!columns-list.PNG|thumbnail!

The problem was the field name *'Type'* is not shown under the list. The workaround would be rename the field name to some meaningful name such as *'<Something> Type'*.

It would be great that JIRA is able to shows more than 24 fields in the Columns list or we can set a limitation in General Configuration.
fields.summary: User not able to search some custom field name in Issue Navigator Columns

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40344].
  {panel}

Hi!

I'm considering JIRA as BPM with involveness of big bosses for key approvals.

I found instruction 'Customize how transitions appear' in issue screen (https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Advanced+workflow+configuration?src=search#Advancedworkflowconfiguration-customisingtransitionsonviewissue) but can't find anything how can I move all common items (buttons) such as 'Comment', 'Attach file', 'Log work' etc under menu 'More actions'.

The goal is to avoid big bosses be overloaded with tons of buttons.
Just to hide ALL actions under 'More actions' menu or manage the order of them. Ideally - to be able manage the appearance depending of issue's status.

if possible - please provide the guideline how to remove ALL technical fileds and buttons and leave the possibility to show only *custom text with custom fields / buttons*.

thanks!
fields.summary: How to configure basic issue menu / screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40343].
  {panel}

In my example:

* TIme Tracking with 7.5 hours per day, 5 days per week
* Time format - days
* Default unit - hour

!_BT-6__TESTSTS_-_JIRA.jpg|thumbnail!

What is more odd is if you put 45m, you get .1d, yet 30m is .5h, 1h is still 1h.
fields.summary: Default Time Tracking Numbers Not Consistent

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40340].
  {panel}

Suggestion:
Having the option to keep the user active in JIRA while he/she is inactive in Active Directory (AD) would be better.

Use case: 
Users who are in vacation period would be deactivated in active directory. Having the above option would be a better option in order for the users to still be "assignable"

Current behavior tested in JIRA 6.2 and 6.3:
If the users have been deactivated in Active Directory, then the same users will be inactive in JIRA.
fields.summary: Option to keep the user active in JIRA (When user's is inactive in Active Directory)
Update Balsamiq Mockups OnDemand to 2.2.25
Enhance loading of releasenotes templates

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40336].
  {panel}

Hi

It would be very useful for us to be able to filter on 'days since last comment' eg. days since last comment > 2. 
Linked to this would be the request to have a column for 'days since last comment'' so when viewing a list of issues can see and sort by the number of days since the last comment.

Thanks
Laura

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40335].
  {panel}

Latest Jira OnDemand version has these 2 System add-ons appearing as a user-installed add-on:
* Gadget Spec Publisher Plugin
* Atlassian User Management - Provisioning Plugin

If disabled by the admin user, Jira will be locked at restart and loose User Management menu option.

They were listed as System add-on previously.

Customers disable plugins in desire of getting better performance out of their instance and end up needing Support to restore functionality.

*Workaround:*
Plugins can be enable by following [JIRA does not Start Due to Disabled Bundled Plugin|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/JIRA+does+not+Start+Due+to+Disabled+Bundled+Plugin]
fields.summary: 2 System add-ons show on user-installed list and can be disabled by user
An option to prevent/filter JIRA spamming mails in short intervals
Markup to link to comment of a ticket from another ticket
SUGGESTION: Allow user to generate a "Static Query" from the results of a dynamic query.
A more user friendly navigation to disable/enable dark feature
Configure Mail Handler to Resolve Issue from Incoming Mail
Ability to choose user when installing JIRA
Service Desk 2 collaborator+

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40322].
  {panel}

h4. Summary
List of gadgets went missing when trying to add one to the dashboard

h4. Environment
JIRA 6.3.13
Korean Language Pack

h4. Steps to Reproduce
It's not easily reproducible, but from one of the Support case:
# Start JIRA 6.3.13
# Install Korean Language pack from [here|https://translations.atlassian.com/dashboard/download#/JIRA/6.3.13]
# Change System Language to Korean
# Create new Dashboard
# Try to add new Gadget into the dashboard

h4. Expected Results
Gadget list should be available as usual

h4. Actual Results
Gadget windows is empty, and this message is found in the log:
{code}
2014-09-28 09:15:11,300 http-bio-8080-exec-36 WARN user 555x182356x1 1qfgr4p xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx /rest/config/1.0/directory.json [directory.internal.impl.DirectoryImpl] Could not retrieve directory entries from application-provided gadget specs: plugin gadget 'Key{pluginKey='com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira', location='gadgets/days-remaining.xml'}' failed validation
-------------------------------------------------------------------
2014-10-08 10:26:27,673 http-bio-8080-exec-2 WARN user 626x177724x1 1tmk3wu xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx,127.0.0.1 /rest/config/1.0/directory.json [directory.internal.impl.DirectoryImpl] Could not retrieve directory entries from application-provided gadget specs: null
{code}
!Gadget list.png|thumbnail!

h4. Notes
Please try enabling Safe Mode in the Add-on Manager to verify if any plugins are doing this - if the problem goes away after enabling Safe Mode you can try enabling each plugin one-by-one, and testing the gadget list, to identify which one is at fault.
Also, certain language packs containing invalid characters are known to cause this problem to occur - this is an active bug tracked in TRANS-1233. Disabling the language packs, or editing them such that invalid characters are not containing in them could effectively workaround the problem.
fields.summary: Missing gadget list in the dashboard

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

Currently creating a support zip does not gather application links information. It would be nice if a file with the following information could be generated and added:

- Number of links
- Application Name
- Matching URLs
- Matching IP
fields.summary: Applinks Settings Output to Logs

fields.description:
It is only possible to have 1 "from any" transition for a status at the moment.

The main reason for having more than one is to allow for different specific actions that end at the same status. For example, approving and rejecting a request from any step, that takes you to the Closed status.
fields.summary: Allow multiple "from any" transitions for a status

fields.description: Right now it's not possible to use the Add Transition modal to add a "from any" transition to a given status, instead you have to use the checkbox available with the status selected.
fields.summary: It should be possible to add a "from any" transition with the Add Transition modal
Recovery of JIRA index snapshot is very slow
Allow custom field sort descending

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40315].
  {panel}

Just like Confluence has the ability to create personal spaces (that are driven off of the user's username), it would be really cool if users could also have their own Personal Projects in JIRA.  

The user should be automatically added to the Project Admin role of the project.  

Project keys using the user's username is a safe bet since they _should_ be unique within an instance.

I have had several requests by users to create projects, with the project key being their username, so they could keep a list of to-dos and such of their own.  And then sometimes those issues get moved into the shared projects.
fields.summary: Personal Projects

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40313].
  {panel}

h4. Steps

# Attach a ZIP protected by a password to an issue
# Expand its contents
# Click any entry

h4. Expectation
Any of:
* The entry should not be a link for download
* Error message
* Prompt for a password

h4. Reality
Error page (500). An error with a stacktrace is emitted to the logs.
fields.summary: Encrypted archives are not handled gracefully when attached to an issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40312].
  {panel}

When splitting JIRA, admins will do a clean up of some projects on the two instances. During this clean up, the issue linking will gets deleted when the other project is deleted.

It would be great if we can preseve the data of issue linking when deleting the project by 
* Having options to automatically comment on the affected issues that there was issue links and add the URL
* Or, have the Issue links still exist but show a text mentioning the project may have been deleted or moved

Preserving the issue links data should be an option choose by the admin that is deleting the project.
fields.summary: Preserve Issue Links Data when Splitting JIRA

fields.description:
Note: This issue is occurring on Windows Operating Systems

*to replicate:*

       1.  Follow the instructions to restore JIRA data from an XML backup:
            https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA060/Restoring+Data

       2.  Once the data has been restored, log in and confirm that the attachments, avatars & logos are not present.
fields.summary: When restoring JIRA data from an XML backup, the attachments, avatars & logos are missing.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40310].
  {panel}

Say you have two statuses, *OPEN* and *START PROGRESS*.
OPEN has the *jira.permission.assignable.projectrole* property set to *role_A*.
START PROGRESS has the  *jira.permission.assignable.projectrole* property set to *role_B*. 

Transitioning from open to start progress, there is a transition screen with the Assignee field. If you try to assign to someone who is in role_B, the assign will fail with error "cannot be assigned issues". (despite the auto-complete manages to show the user as an assignable user!)

This is *not* the intended behavior because in *JIRA 6.3.4 or older*, you can assign to a user in role_B without problems, since users in role_B matches the workflow property configured in the START PROGRESS status, which is the destination of the transition.
fields.summary: Changing assignees in transition screen is taking into account the permission property of the CURRENT status, not the DESTINATION status

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40294].
  {panel}

One of the teams in Shipit 27 made some changes to the JIRA HipChat plugin, in order to make it easier to see that JIRA is able to send notifications to HipChat, and also to improve the page for configuring HipChat notifications.

The improvements include:
- providing a HipChat entry on the project admin page that either links you to a list of your existing HipChat notifications (if you have HipChat connected) or provides a link for downloading HipChat (if you don't have HipChat connected)
- some improvements to the actual HipChat Notification config page (e.g. auto-complete JQL, a room-picker element instead of a long list of the available rooms)

The docs should probably updated so that customers know they are able to jump to their existing HipChat notifications via the new project admin link. In order to create new HipChat notifications, users still need to use the old workflow. If they don't have any notifications configured when they click the new project admin link then they are shown a message about how HipChat notifications are created by adding a post function. If there are some HipChat notifications already configured, then clicking the link in the project admin page shows a list of the existing notifications, and clicking on one of these takes the user directly to the config page for that notification.
fields.summary: Update JIRA Hip Chat plugin docs to reflect changes made in Shipit 27

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40291].
  {panel}

In extremely rare situations, after a JIRA crash/restart or network/database connectivity problems, the directory configuration seems to be lost. Examples are
* [JRA-36677|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-36677]
* [JIRA drops LDAP configuration - java.naming.provider.url property does not contain a URL|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/JIRA+drops+LDAP+configuration+-+java.naming.provider.url+property+does+not+contain+a+URL].
* [Connection to Crowd Fails due to URI-Reference required|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Connection+to+Crowd+Fails+due+to+URI-Reference+required]

There are two parts to this suggestion:
# JIRA should prevent the database corruption.
# This kind of corruption, being very rare and unexpected, is very difficult to detect manually. During startup/ access, JIRA should verify if mandatory directory parameters exist and inform the administrator if there are parameters missing - so that it is much more easier for administrators to verify and fix the configuration.
fields.summary: JIRA should prevent corruption of directory configuration and notify user if mandatory configuration is missing

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40280].
  {panel}

At this moment JIRA does have an APi that allows to trigger a check of all plugins updates that are available and trigger their download and upgrade.

Providing an API for performing this would be of a great importance as it would allow to automate the upgrade of JIRA instances, and even scheduling these updates at times of low load. 

At this moment this operation can be done only manually so it cannot be automated.

Also by having an automated upgrade option, this would allow to keep the staging / testing instances with bleeding age versions, allowing to test the effect of the new software versions over instances, preventing problems and downtimes on production instances.
fields.summary: Provide API for automating upgrade of JIRA plugins

The filter is still not favorited.

Favorite the filter directly from the list of filters.

h3. Description
When creating a 'Project Management' project; the issue type scheme, workflow schemes and screen scheme defaults back to 'Simple Issue Tracker' schemes.

h3. Replication
# Create a project of type 'Project Management'
# Go to *Project Administration* and check the schemes. It will show 'Simple Issue Tracker'

Schemes should be showing as 'Project Management' schemes

h3. Actual results
Schemes are following 'Simple Issue Tracker' default schemes

h3. Workaround
None at the moment
